descriptionMarkdown:
**Module to inhibit buildup of higher IDs**

Here you find a blueprint for a cluster of combinators that can be attached to a existing RequesterBase to add a certain behaviour. 
Those clusters are subsequently called "module". 

Explanation of the module is below. 


**A system to deliver items by train from a central base to outposts.** 


see also: [ItemDelivery - ProviderBase](https://factorioprints.com/view/-L4ThUDlc3ebWiNTQHbv)

see also: [ItemDelivery - RequesterBase](https://factorioprints.com/view/-L4Thzw_FogBACMitAlR)

see also: [ItemDelivery - TestSetup](https://factorioprints.com/view/-L4Tj7Wzf3BhoIh_kFoE)

see also: [ItemDelivery - Requester Module "Inhibitor"](https://factorioprints.com/view/-LX9bQG1RsJzUXNQPRm3)

see also: [ItemDelivery - Requester Module "BotLossPrevention"](https://factorioprints.com/view/-LXA1qPbtXRp8KI8ZPxW)


--- 

- **usecase: **
 - you are using the ItemDelivery system to build up you lategame base
 - you want to make sure that the buildup of a certain subfactory / ProductionCell is completed before another is started
 - e.g. you want to make sure that ID 400 is completed before buildup for ID 420 is begun
 - this applies for all IDs that are greater than the ID of the RequesterBase with the blocking module

---
- **usage**
 - module is blueprinted over existing RequesterBase
 - blueprint will fit to any existing RequesterBase
 - module will send a blocking signal if 
   - RequesterBase is enabled 
   - RequesterBase is at least at step 1
   - it's own ID is reached (in the clocked counter)
   - no item request can be made (because items of last delivery are not used up)
   - the last step is not reached (the last step effectively disables the RequesterBase)
 - this module will not block requests of IDs lower than the RequesterBase it is attached to 
 - no additional configuration is required. The RequesterBase ID is read from the existing base. 

--- 
- **combinator-switches**
 - the module has two constant combinators that can either 
   - enforce the blocking signal even if buildup is completed
     - the buildup of higher IDs is supressed 
   - disable the blocking signal despite the existence of the module


---
- **annotation** 
 - the blocking only works reliable if the distance to the next higher ID is at least 20. 

---

- **compatibility**
 - RequesterBase v09 and above
 - ProviderBase v09 and above

--- 

- **changelog** 
 - 2019-01-26 v04
   - initial release
title: ItemDelivery - Requester Module "Inhibitor" [update 2019-01-26 v04]
